channel.title: Object click handler?

item.title: Object click handler?
item.dc:creator: @openice123 openice123
item.description:
@openice123 wrote:

i just got done makeing a object click handler and it was easier then it seemed
anways…before i put my wood cutting into it was perfect it gave me logs and chopped down the tree
but the only problem is is that now that i moved it in it cant identify objectX or objectY
ive tried multiple things like… adding a int into the handler adding c. infront of it and some others…
anyone have any idea? it also does it for the minning.

heres what is the click one part for the trees

[code]import java.io.*;

public class objc {

public void objc1(int objectid, client c) {

switch(objectid) {

case 1276:
case 1277:
case 1278:
case 1279:
case 1280:
case 1282:
case 1283:
case 1284:
case 1285:
case 1286:
case 1289:
case 1290:
case 1291:
case 1315:
case 1316:
case 1318:
case 1319:
case 1330:
case 1331:
case 1332:
case 1365:
case 1383:
case 1384:
case 2409:
case 3033:
case 3034:
case 3035:
case 3036:
case 3881:
case 3882:
case 3883:
case 5902:
case 5903:
case 5904:
c.Woodcutting(“regular”, 0, 25, 1511, 1, objectid, c.objectX, c.objectY, 875, 18.9);
break;

case 1281:
case 3037:
c.Woodcutting(“oak”, 15, 37, 1521, 1, objectid, c.objectX, c.objectY, 875, 15);
break;

case 1308:
case 5551:
case 5552:
case 5553:
c.Woodcutting(“willow”, 35, 67, 1519, 1, objectid, c.objectX, c.objectY, 875, 13);
break;

case 1307:
case 4674:
c.Woodcutting(“maple”, 45, 100, 1517, 1, objectid, c.objectX, c.objectY, 875, 10);
break;

case 1309:
c.Woodcutting(“yew”, 60, 175, 1515, 1, objectid, c.objectX, c.objectY, 875, 5);
break;

case 9036:
c.Woodcutting(“teak”, 35, 85, 6333, 1, objectid, c.objectX, c.objectY, 875, 15);
break;

case 9034:
c.Woodcutting(“Mahogany”, 50, 125, 6332, 1, objectid, c.objectX, c.objectY, 875, 17);
break;

case 1306:
c.Woodcutting(“magic”, 75, 250, 1513, 1, objectid, c.objectX, c.objectY, 875, 3.9);
break;

}
}[/code]
